solution_line_template: Adam had twice as many sheep as the cows, so {sheep_per_cow} sheep/cow * {cows} cows = <<{sheep_per_cow}*{cows}={sheep}>>{sheep} sheep.
For every sheep, he bought {pigs_per_sheep} pigs, so he bought {pigs_per_sheep} pigs/sheep * {sheep} sheep = <<{pigs_per_sheep}*{sheep}={pigs}>>{pigs} pigs.
In total on the farm, there were {pigs} pigs + {sheep} sheep + {cows} cows = <<{pigs}+{sheep}+{cows}={total_animals}>>{total_animals} animals.
